intro: Euphrasia scabra, commonly known as rough eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are hairy and have a rough texture, which gives it its common name. Euphrasia scabra is often found in shaded or partially shaded environments and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
